name: starrwulfe >>federated<<
summary: J L Gatewood's Indieweb powered home in the Fediverse.

content.html: J L Gatewood's Indieweb powered home in the Fediverse.
content.value: J L Gatewood's Indieweb powered home in the Fediverse.

photo.alt: User Avatar of J L Gatewood

content.html:
Yarns is a microsub server plug-in available for WordPress that allows with the aid of different connecting apps to read RSS feeds and use Indieweb techniques to interact with them.¬†

What‚Äôs the use case for this?

Because I‚Äôm using this site for all my social media needs, being able to view, subscribe/follow different feeds from the source, and even resyndicate, and/or respond to them is a better workflow than the one I‚Äôm using now:

  • check RSS reader and see thing I want to respond to.
  • copy URL to thing
  • open another window and log into my site, and respond there.
  • kinda profit?! OK, so it‚Äôs not really that complicated I guess, but having an all-in-one method to just hit a ‚Äúreply‚Äù button is a bit easier, no? Not to mention the ease at being able to keep tabs on read/unreads and use it as a ‚Äúread-it-later‚Äù service without having yet another app for that too.

How easy is it to use?

Pretty simple once I figured out where the settings were‚Äì seriously, that was the hardest part because that‚Äôs where you set up the feeds subscription. For me, it‚Äôs sitting in the same spot as the rest of the Indieweb plugins. I expected it to be more like Friends which is a plug-in that allows WordPress blogs to ‚Äúfollow‚Äù other blogs (and anything that runs ActivityPub like Mastodon accounts, but more on that later). Friends has its own separate section that allows you to view feeds directly from your website‚Äôs front end when logged in‚Ä¶ Doesn‚Äôt work for me though, as it constantly shows ‚ÄúFeed not found‚Äù while simultaneously showing there are posts in many feeds and I can go into the ‚Äúback end‚Äù and see them all. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs supposed to work that way though, so that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm giving this a shot. Also the Friends plug-in creates users on your WordPress instance to utilize the addtional rows of database entries. An easy way to ensure everything gets backed up since no additional tables are needed to hold all that data this way. To your wordpress installation, it just looks like all these new users are making private posts. I‚Äôm not opposed to this method really.

How would you improve it?

Remember, my goal with the site is for it to be my social hub. As we‚Äôve been seeing over the past few months thanks to a certain avian SNS site‚Äôs changes, it‚Äôs FOSS alternative Mastodon has zoomed into the spotlight and users are switching to the network from or at least using in conjunction with Twitter. Because I want Starrwulfe.xyz to be my ‚ÄúMastodon/ActivityPub‚Äù instance, I‚Äôd like any way to make that easier.

  • Allowing Yarns to officially ‚Äúfollow‚Äù ActivityPub accounts would be very welcome. This means having Yarns fire off a ‚Äúfollowed‚Äù ActivityPub in the background. It would need to hook in to all the same places that ‚ÄúFriends‚Äù currently does as well, but it shouldn‚Äôt be hard since its well documented in code. Adding in some way to turn @-@ usernames into their URLs and discovering all their feeds is a good look too‚Ä¶ Speaking of which‚Äì

Can we get a way to discover all the feeds for a particular entity?

  • The cool thing about Friends is that you can create a ‚Äúuser‚Äù and save all the feeds associated with that user in one place and in one stream!
  • When following a blog that has feeds for each category/tag/area
  • When following a person that has feeds for their main site, micro-blog, and social media site.

Another thing I want is some kind of minimal reader/publisher _as a part of_my site.

  • Create an ‚Äúonboard reader/publisher UI for those times access to Monagle, AllTogetherTomorrow, Indigenous, etc are all down.

Lastly, I‚Äôd like to be able to import/export OPML files.

  • I have a bunch of feeds that could be chucked into Yarns right now if I had this, but have to spend time keying them in by hand‚Ä¶

This is definitely not a rant and merely suggestions on how to improve upon a good idea from a neophyte user‚Äôs point of view. This post will be updated as I get more adept at this and/or the makers of the plug in implement anything incorporating any of my suggestions.

‚Äìjlg

What‚Äôs the use case for this?
Because I‚Äôm using this site for all my social media needs, being able to view, subscribe/follow different feeds from the source, and even resyndicate, and/or respond to them is a better workflow than the one I‚Äôm using now:

check RSS reader and see thing I want to respond to.
copy URL to thing
open another window and log into my site, and respond there.
kinda profit?! OK, so it‚Äôs not really that complicated I guess, but having an all-in-one method to just hit a ‚Äúreply‚Äù button is a bit easier, no? Not to mention the ease at being able to keep tabs on read/unreads and use it as a ‚Äúread-it-later‚Äù service without having yet another app for that too.

Pretty simple once I figured out where the settings were‚Äì seriously, that was the hardest part because that‚Äôs where you set up the feeds subscription. Friends has its own separate section that allows you to view feeds directly from your website‚Äôs front end when logged in‚Ä¶ Doesn‚Äôt work for me though, as it constantly shows ‚ÄúFeed not found‚Äù while simultaneously showing there are posts in many feeds and I can go into the ‚Äúback end‚Äù and see them all. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs supposed to work that way though, so that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm giving this a shot. Also the Friends plug-in creates users on your WordPress instance to utilize the addtional rows of database entries. An easy way to ensure everything gets backed up since no additional tables are needed to hold all that data this way. To your wordpress installation, it just looks like all these new users are making private posts. I‚Äôm not opposed to this method really.
How would you improve it?
Remember, my goal with the site is for it to be my social hub. As we‚Äôve been seeing over the past few months thanks to a certain avian SNS site‚Äôs changes, it‚Äôs FOSS alternative Mastodon has zoomed into the spotlight and users are switching to the network from or at least using in conjunction with Twitter. It would need to hook in to all the same places that ‚ÄúFriends‚Äù currently does as well, but it shouldn‚Äôt be hard since its well documented in code. When following a blog that has feeds for each category/tag/area
When following a person that has feeds for their main site, micro-blog, and social media site.

Another thing I want is some kind of minimal reader/publisher _as a part of_my site.

Create an ‚Äúonboard reader/publisher UI for those times access to Monagle, AllTogetherTomorrow, Indigenous, etc are all down.

Lastly, I‚Äôd like to be able to import/export OPML files.

I have a bunch of feeds that could be chucked into Yarns right now if I had this, but have to spend time keying them in by hand‚Ä¶

name: Day #14 of working on my indieweb site

photo.alt: User Avatar of J L Gatewood

content.html:
I managed to get the site itself up and running without a ton of hitches and it seems to be humming along well with most of the full requirements installed/coded in/shade-tree-jerry-rigged in.

To recap, this site has to:

  • serve as a digital garden; where I collect a lot of the things I learn online in one place (this also means some of that stuff YOU can‚Äôt see, but I as a logged in user, can.)
  • serve as my social media hub. Anything I post, like, favorite, etc, should be catalogued here.
    • I have a way now to post/like/repost (even quote post) and more to Mastodon (this site IS a Mastodon/ActivityWeb compatible site; try looking up @starrwulfe@starrwulfe.xyz from your account in the Fediverse!)
    • I can do the same to Twitter as well as Reddit.
    • I can comment, star and follow Github issues and projects.
    • I can check-in to places with Swarm and have it save privately here. This is really good for when I‚Äôm somewhere new and want to save all the information for later reference but don‚Äôt want to let the world know where I am at that moment.
    • I can backfeed posts from Instagram and Facebook, which is better than nothing‚Äì I may have a workaround to hydrate posts/create them through IFTTT or Jetpack in theory‚Ä¶ Stay tuned.
  • Keep copies of the media and posts backed up. I‚Äôm actually using a managed hosting service that backs everything up to some S3 buckets I had laying around from an old project, but I also use this plug-in that sends everything to my NAS farm here at the house too. From there, it‚Äôs backed up to a some more clouds. Can never have enough backup.
  • Eventually handle my main site‚Äôs duties. Right now that website shows off my professional side as a journalist/technical writer; I need to migrate all that over here and figure out how I‚Äôm gonna handle the URL‚Ä¶ Overlay or redirect or‚Ä¶ Let me know any other ideas!
  • Look good doing all that! I still don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm keeping this theme yet. Even if I do, I need to change a lot in the CSS. I want a more minimalist aesthetic:
    • only system fonts, so you‚Äôre not waiting for a .ttf of a font you‚Äôll never use other than to see my site to download.
    • Only Unicode glyphs including using emoji for icon packs (although the icons here are pretty light, I just prefer the aesthetics. I‚Äôd also have to get rid of WordPress‚Äô use of Twimoji maybe. ü§î) There‚Äôs plug ins for this though‚Ä¶
    • Redo the .css so there‚Äôs less negative space. I love this layout, but want it to be more compact. Also want to switch up the fonts‚Äì I like san-serifs to read the body of a post probably due to me spending eons of time in the terminal (preferably monospace ones because ÁßÅÊôÇ„ÄÖÊó•Êú¨Ë™û„ÅßË™¨Êòé„Åü„ÇÅÂÖ•Âäõ„Åó and Japanese is always monospaced so it flows better)
    • Would be nice if this site looked good in w3m/browsh text browsers, as well as feed readers, read-it-later bookmarking apps and so on.
  • Serve as a feed reader. Since this is already effectively an ActivityWeb instance, part of the how I follow others from here is thru a plugin called Friends, but it‚Äôs kinda heavy. Maybe Yarn is the way to go; both are RSS feed readers but only Friends actually sends a ‚Äúfollowing‚Äù webmention/activitypub notice to the site/person being followed and lets them know they‚Äôre now being followed by me. I think David Shanske is thinking of adding that ability to Yarn though which would allow for some fun things via microsub too.

As it is now, it seems to be doing most of the above and just needs a few more cosmetics at this point in the way of organization, taxonomy of posts and workflow practice. Other itches needing scratching are:

  • In particular I want to replace/augment my Instagram with Pixelfed (https://pixelfed.social/starrwulfe) and need to figure out how to connect them. Maybe through my blog?)
  • Get check-ins and weather reporting right. That‚Äôs definitely a David Shanske question.
  • Make a calendar for RSVP/scheduling that can read iCalendar streams.
  • Podcasting/Video streaming. There‚Äôs probably a plug in for that.
  • Books/Games/TV/Movies section that will replace GoodReads, LetterBoxd, and other media listing apps.

If you‚Äôre also ‚Äúdoing too much‚Äù with your website and know of some ways to do some of the above or know something else I don‚Äôt, send me a webmention/toot/tweet to this page! And if you happened to wander by here and just wanna say hi, you can always use Comment Parade and leave a quick message here as well.

I managed to get the site itself up and running without a ton of hitches and it seems to be humming along well with most of the full requirements installed/coded in/shade-tree-jerry-rigged in.To recap, this site has to:




serve as a digital garden; where I collect a lot of the things I learn online in one place (this also means some of that stuff YOU can‚Äôt see, but I as a logged in user, can.)



serve as my social media hub. Anything I post, like, favorite, etc, should be catalogued here.

I have a way now to post/like/repost (even quote post) and more to Mastodon (this site IS a Mastodon/ActivityWeb compatible site; try looking up @starrwulfe@starrwulfe.xyz from your account in the Fediverse!)



I can do the same to Twitter as well as Reddit.



I can comment, star and follow Github issues and projects.



I can check-in to places with Swarm and have it save privately here. This is really good for when I‚Äôm somewhere new and want to save all the information for later reference but don‚Äôt want to let the world know where I am at that moment.



I can backfeed posts from Instagram and Facebook, which is better than nothing‚Äì I may have a workaround to hydrate posts/create them through IFTTT or Jetpack in theory‚Ä¶ Stay tuned.





Keep copies of the media and posts backed up. I‚Äôm actually using a managed hosting service that backs everything up to some S3 buckets I had laying around from an old project, but I also use this plug-in that sends everything to my NAS farm here at the house too. From there, it‚Äôs backed up to a some more clouds. Can never have enough backup.



Eventually handle my main site‚Äôs duties. Right now that website shows off my professional side as a journalist/technical writer; I need to migrate all that over here and figure out how I‚Äôm gonna handle the URL‚Ä¶ Overlay or redirect or‚Ä¶ Let me know any other ideas!



Look good doing all that! I still don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm keeping this theme yet. Even if I do, I need to change a lot in the CSS. I want a more minimalist aesthetic:

only system fonts, so you‚Äôre not waiting for a .ttf of a font you‚Äôll never use other than to see my site to download.



Only Unicode glyphs including using emoji for icon packs (although the icons here are pretty light, I just prefer the aesthetics. I‚Äôd also have to get rid of WordPress‚Äô use of Twimoji maybe. ü§î) There‚Äôs plug ins for this though‚Ä¶



Redo the .css so there‚Äôs less negative space. I love this layout, but want it to be more compact. Also want to switch up the fonts‚Äì I like san-serifs to read the body of a post probably due to me spending eons of time in the terminal (preferably monospace ones because ÁßÅÊôÇ„ÄÖÊó•Êú¨Ë™û„ÅßË™¨Êòé„Åü„ÇÅÂÖ•Âäõ„Åó and Japanese is always monospaced so it flows better)



Would be nice if this site looked good in w3m/browsh text browsers, as well as feed readers, read-it-later bookmarking apps and so on.





Serve as a feed reader. Since this is already effectively an ActivityWeb instance, part of the how I follow others from here is thru a plugin called Friends, but it‚Äôs kinda heavy. Maybe Yarn is the way to go; both are RSS feed readers but only Friends actually sends a ‚Äúfollowing‚Äù webmention/activitypub notice to the site/person being followed and lets them know they‚Äôre now being followed by me. I think David Shanske is thinking of adding that ability to Yarn though which would allow for some fun things via microsub too.





As it is now, it seems to be doing most of the above and just needs a few more cosmetics at this point in the way of organization, taxonomy of posts and workflow practice. Other itches needing scratching are:

In particular I want to replace/augment my Instagram with Pixelfed (https://pixelfed.social/starrwulfe) and need to figure out how to connect them. Maybe through my blog?)
Get check-ins and weather reporting right. That‚Äôs definitely a David Shanske question.
Make a calendar for RSVP/scheduling that can read iCalendar streams.
Podcasting/Video streaming. There‚Äôs probably a plug in for that.
Books/Games/TV/Movies section that will replace GoodReads, LetterBoxd, and other media listing apps.

If you‚Äôre also ‚Äúdoing too much‚Äù with your website and know of some ways to do some of the above or know something else I don‚Äôt, send me a webmention/toot/tweet to this page! And if you happened to wander by here and just wanna say hi, you can always use Comment Parade and leave a quick message here as well.

name: The Foundation Trilogy (Foundation / Foundation and Empire / Second Foundation )

content.html:
Probably because I read these all in one go, I‚Äôm kinda missing a few points of context here and there, and it‚Äôs been about 30 years or so since I read Azimov for school (aka FORCED! üòú) but know this:

If you‚Äôre watching the Apple TV series, it‚Äôs a different storyline altogether and it‚Äôs a real page turner.

It‚Äôs intriguing how according to the late 1950‚Äôs, we‚Äôre basically supposed to have colonized the solar system by now. If you spent time reading this though, I wouldn‚Äôt blame you for thinking it too.
